title: The Wall Street Journal: Trump administration weighs tariffs to curb steel, aluminum imports
text:
The Trump administration on Friday said it was weighing broad-based tariffs and quotas to curb imports of steel and aluminum to protect national security, though officials stressed no final decisions had been made and the final policy could be limited.

The recommendations were part of internal administration reports released Friday laying out the options for President Donald Trump as he considers how to fulfill a campaign promise to take a more aggressive stance than his predecessors to shield domestic steel and aluminum makers... RELATED VIDEO What the Big Trade Deficit Number Really Means The U.S. trade deficit hit its widest mark since 2008 last year, totaling $566 billion in President Trump's first year in office. WSJ's Gerald F. Seib explains why the number may not be quite as bad as it appears on its face. Photo: AP To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
